entry.value: The metanode is used for filtering upregulated and downregulated proteins after performing a statistical test (e. g. LIMMA). The input data table should contain columns containing p-values (adjusted p-values) and logFC values.%%00010First output port contains only upregulated proteins, second one only downregulated proteins, the third combined list of down and upregulated proteins and the fourth output port contains the original dataset with appended column with the expression change information. All lists but the last one are sorted (up - descending; down and down+up - ascending).%%00010%%00010You can also limit the generated up/down lists; the list will be shortened leaving the cases with higher (up) or lower (down) logFC values.%%00010%%00010=================%%00010%%00010Used programs and tools and their respective licenses at the time of the metanode creation. Version numbers and the licenses might differ based on your local installation. Please inspect your local installation and contact us if you can not locate your local version and or license terms.%%00010%%00010KNIME nodes (The KNIME nodes consists of the following GNU GPL 3.0 License. Licence terms are available here: https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html)%%00010Python 3 (The Python consists of the following Python 3.6 License. Licence terms are available here: https://docs.python.org/3.6/license.html)%%00010R 3.6.3 (The R consists of the following GPL-3 License. License terms are available here: https://www.r-project.org/Licenses/GPL-3)%%00010%%00010The metanode was created in KNIME 4.1.3 running inside the docker image (https://hub.docker.com/r/cfprot/knime/), tag 4.1.3a.%%00010%%00010=================%%00010%%00010This version of metanode is available under the GNU GPL 3.0 License, unless stated otherwise. The full version of the license terms is available at https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html.%%00010Version: 0.3.0 from 2022-04-04%%00010Contact person: Karolina Krystofova (karolina.krystofova@ceitec.muni.cz)%%00010More information can be found at https://github.com/OmicsWorkflows/KNIME_metanodes
Input table with statistical test results
Original table containing columns containing information about expression change
